æ–°é—»æŠ¥é“é•¿å¯¹è¯ç¯‡ç« å†™ä½œèƒ½åŠ›çš„é‡è¦æ€§Directionsï¼š For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to write a short essay on the importance of writing ability and how to develop it. you should write at least 120 words but no more than 180 words.
èŒƒæ–‡ï¼š Tsinghua Universityâ€™s decision to make Writing and Communication a required course has sparked a heated debate recently.
 Many people regard writing as a must-have skill only for certain professions, on which they donâ€™t have to put much emphasis. But writing, as I see it, is a basic ability everyone canâ€™t do without. From composing a well-organized paper, to giving a sharply-focused work report, and even posting a sentiment on WeChat Moments, all aspects of life just require this ability. On top of communications, writing sharpens out logic and cognitive thinking, for it requires reflection, analysis and artful presentation of information and views. So itâ€™s no surprise that top-ranking universities like Harvard made writing a compulsory course even for science majors.
 Then how to improve writing skills? Certainly there is a shortcut to learning layout and word choice. For example, you can read and imitate excellent works, learning skills from them like expression, rhetoric and coherence. But tricks arenâ€™t enough. Since language is mind-based, one can hardly become a good writer without reading extensively and thinking deeply. Hone your thinking skills while reading, and your writing can be really improved.
å†™ä½œå‚¨å¤‡ï¼š
Be it a school, college, workplace or a society, writing has become a vital yardstick to assess oneâ€™s knowledge and intellectuality.
ä¸ç®¡æ˜¯åœ¨ä¸­å°å­¦ï¼Œå¤§å­¦ï¼ŒèŒåœºè¿˜æ˜¯åœ¨ç¤¾ä¼šä¸Šï¼Œå†™ä½œå·²ç»æˆä¸ºè¯„ä¼°ä¸€ä¸ªäººçŸ¥è¯†å’Œæ™ºåŠ›çš„é‡è¦æ ‡å°ºã€‚

Writing improves the thinking process and contributes to the development of critical thinking skills because an individual has to clearly state ideas and lay out arguments in such a way as to cultivate higher order thinking.
å†™ä½œèƒ½å¤Ÿæ”¹å–„æ€ç»´è¿‡ç¨‹ï¼Œå¹¶æœ‰åŠ©äºåŸ¹å…»æ‰¹åˆ¤æ€§æ€ç»´èƒ½åŠ›ï¼Œå› ä¸ºï¼ˆå†™ä½œä¸­ï¼‰ä¸ªäººéœ€è¦æ¸…æ¥šåœ°è¡¨è¿°è§‚ç‚¹å¹¶å±•å¼€è®ºè¯ï¼Œè¿™ç§æ–¹æ³•èƒ½ä½¿æˆ‘ä»¬åŸ¹å…»èµ·é«˜é˜¶æ¨ç†æ€ç»´ã€‚

Taking the time to polish your writing skills is likely to pay off in the longer term, and learning how to write specific types of documents will also be useful. For example, being able to prepare a strong summary is a skill that is extremely useful for briefing senior managers.
èŠ±æ—¶é—´å®Œå–„ä½ çš„å†™ä½œæŠ€å·§ä»é•¿è¿œæ¥çœ‹å¯èƒ½å¾ˆæœ‰ä»·å€¼ï¼Œå­¦ä¹ å†™ä½œä¸€äº›ç‰¹å®šç±»å‹çš„å…¬æ–‡ä¹Ÿå¾ˆæœ‰ç”¨ã€‚ä¸¾ä¸ªä¾‹å­ï¼Œåœ¨ç»™ä¸»ç®¡ä½œç®€æŠ¥æ—¶ï¼Œæå®šä¸€ä»½æœ‰è¯´æœåŠ›çš„æ¦‚è¦å°±æ˜¯ä¸ªç›¸å½“æœ‰ç”¨çš„æŠ€å·§ã€‚

The ability to write the better sentence or choose the better word does not come from a book, the way grammar can come from a book. It comes with experience. With grammar, you can study the rules, memorize them, and then apply them to your writing almost immediately. The subtler aspects of writing can be learned, but they are usually learned over time through a combination of reading, studying the craft of writing, and practicing.

#include <iostream>#include <vector>std::vector<int> slidingWindow(std::vector<int>& nums, int target) {    int left = 0;    int sum = 0;    std::vector<int> result;    for (int right = 0; right < nums.size(); right++) {        sum += nums[right];        while (sum > target) {            sum -= nums[left];            left++;        }        if (sum == target) {            result.assign(nums.begin() + left, nums.begin() + right + 1);            break;        }    }    return result;}int main() {    std::vector<int> nums = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};    int target = 9;    std::vector<int> result = slidingWindow(nums, target);    std::cout << "Subarray with sum " << target << ": ";    for (int num : result) {        std::cout << num << " ";    }    return 0;}

#include <iostream>#include <queue>class SlidingWindow {public:    SlidingWindow(int size) : windowSize(size) {}    void sendData(int data) {        if (window.size() < windowSize) {            window.push(data);            std::cout << "Data " << data << " sent.\n";        } else {            std::cout << "Window is full. Data " << data << " is waiting.\n";        }    }    void acknowledge() {        if (!window.empty()) {            std::cout << "Data " << window.front() << " acknowledged.\n";            window.pop();        }    }private:    int windowSize;    std::queue<int> window;};int main() {    SlidingWindow sw(3);    for (int i = 1; i <= 5; ++i) {        sw.sendData(i);    }    sw.acknowledge();    sw.sendData(6);    return 0;}

content: è®¡ç®—åœ¨ä¸–ç•Œä¸Šçš„å¤©æ•°#include <stdio.h>int main(){        int year1,year2,month1,month2,day1,day2;        int a[13]= {0,31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31};        printf("birthday:2001 02 06:");        scanf("%d %d %d",&year1,&month1,&day1);        printf("now:2022 05 16:");        scanf("%d %d %d",&year2,&month2,&day2);        int num=0,i,j,k;        if((year2-year1)>1)        {                for(i=year1+1;i<=year2-1;i++)                {                        if(i%4==0&&i%100!=0||i%400==0)                        {                                num=num+366;                        }                        else num=num+365;                }        }        if(year1%4==0&&year1%100!=0||year1%400==0) a[2]=29;        if(year1==year2)        {                for(i=month1+1;i<month2;i++)                {                        num=num+a[i];                }                num=num+(a[month1]-day1)+day2;        }        a[2]=28;        if(year1!=year2)        {                if(year1%4==0&&year1%100!=0||year1%400==0) a[2]=29;                for(i=month1+1;i<=12;i++)                {                        num+=a[i];                }				num+=(a[month1]-day1);                a[2]=28;                if(year2%4==0&&year1%100!=0||year2%400==0) a[2]=29;                for(i=month2-1;i>=1;i--)                {                num+=a[i];                }                num+=day2;        }        printf("You have lived %d days.\n",num);        return 0;}

return false;        }        if ( (m_semid=semget(key,1,0666)) == -1)        { perror("init 2 semget()"); return false; }            return true;      }      // ä¿¡å·é‡åˆ›å»ºæˆåŠŸåï¼Œè¿˜éœ€è¦æŠŠå®ƒåˆå§‹åŒ–æˆvalueã€‚      union semun sem_union;
